definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Bassy smiled proudly and said, "Did you guys see that?Eat the meat, not the hook."
sentences.chinese: 巴思洋洋得意地說，“看見了吧，喫肉，但是不上鉤。

sentences.english: The boy was flushed with good examination results.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩因考試成績優秀而洋洋得意。

sentences.english: It jauntily, above oneself, just take the advantage of temporarily downwind stopped.
sentences.chinese: 它洋洋得意，自高自大，只不過趁一時順風罷了。

sentences.english: He seems take pride to make such fatuous remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎對自己笨拙的講話還洋洋得意。

sentences.english: In this respect, Japan seems to be a smug and pathetic country.
sentences.chinese: 從這個角度講，日本是一個洋洋得意的可憐國家。

sentences.english: She gloated over her son’s achievements.
sentences.chinese: 她對兒子的成就感到洋洋得意。

sentences.english: Jack basked in his wife's admiration.
sentences.chinese: 傑克得到他妻子的讚賞而洋洋得意。

sentences.english: The boy glowed with pride when he caught a fish.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩逮住一條魚時洋洋得意。

definition: joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
variant of 得意洋洋[de2 yi4 yang2 yang2]
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
